Door Lock.name: Door Lock
Door Lock.description: An interface to a generic way to secure a door

commands.name: LockDoor
commands.description: This command causes the lock device to lock the door.

commands.name: UnlockDoor
commands.description: This command causes the lock device to unlock the door.

commands.name: UnlockWithTimeout
commands.description: This command causes the lock device to unlock the door with a timeout parameter.

commands.name: SetWeekDaySchedule
commands.description: Set a weekly repeating schedule for a specified user.

commands.name: GetWeekDaySchedule
commands.description: Retrieve the specific weekly schedule for the specific user.

commands.name: GetWeekDayScheduleResponse
commands.description: Returns the weekly repeating schedule data for the specified schedule index.

commands.name: ClearWeekDaySchedule
commands.description: Clear the specific weekly schedule or all weekly schedules for the specific user.

commands.name: SetYearDaySchedule
commands.description: Set a time-specific schedule ID for a specified user.

commands.name: GetYearDaySchedule
commands.description: Returns the year day schedule data for the specified schedule and user indexes.

commands.name: GetYearDayScheduleResponse
commands.description: Returns the year day schedule data for the specified schedule and user indexes.

commands.name: ClearYearDaySchedule
commands.description: Clears the specific year day schedule or all year day schedules for the specific user.

commands.name: SetHolidaySchedule
commands.description: Set the holiday Schedule by specifying local start time and local end time with respect to any Lock Operating Mode.

commands.name: GetHolidaySchedule
commands.description: Get the holiday schedule for the specified index.

commands.name: GetHolidayScheduleResponse
commands.description: Returns the Holiday Schedule Entry for the specified Holiday ID.

commands.name: ClearHolidaySchedule
commands.description: Clears the holiday schedule or all holiday schedules.

commands.name: SetUser
commands.description: Set User into the lock.

commands.name: GetUser
commands.description: Retrieve User.

commands.name: GetUserResponse
commands.description: Returns the User for the specified UserIndex.

commands.name: ClearUser
commands.description: Clears a User or all Users.

commands.name: SetCredential
commands.description: Set a credential (e.g. PIN, RFID, Fingerprint, etc.) into the lock for a new user, existing user, or ProgrammingUser.

commands.name: SetCredentialResponse
commands.description: Returns the status for setting the specified credential.

commands.name: GetCredentialStatus
commands.description: Retrieve the status of a particular credential (e.g. PIN, RFID, Fingerprint, etc.) by index.

commands.name: GetCredentialStatusResponse
commands.description: Returns the status for the specified credential.

commands.name: ClearCredential
commands.description: Clear one, one type, or all credentials except ProgrammingPIN credential.

events.name: DoorLockAlarm
events.description: The door lock cluster provides several alarms which can be sent when there is a critical state on the door lock.

events.name: DoorStateChange
events.description: The door lock server sends out a DoorStateChange event when the door lock door state changes.

events.name: LockOperation
events.description: The door lock server sends out a LockOperation event when the event is triggered by the various lock operation sources.

events.name: LockOperationError
events.description: The door lock server sends out a LockOperationError event when a lock operation fails for various reasons.

events.name: LockUserChange
events.description: The door lock server sends out a LockUserChange event when a lock user, schedule, or credential change has occurred.

Content Launcher.name: Content Launcher
Content Launcher.description: This cluster provides an interface for launching content on a media player device such as a TV or Speaker.

commands.name: LaunchContent
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL launch the specified content with optional search criteria.

commands.name: LaunchURL
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL launch content from the specified URL.

commands.name: LauncherResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to LaunchContent command.

Switch.name: Switch
Switch.description:
This cluster exposes interactions with a switch device, for the purpose of using those interactions by other devices.
Two types of switch devices are supported: latching switch (e.g. rocker switch) and momentary switch (e.g. push button), distinguished with their feature flags.
Interactions with the switch device are exposed as attributes (for the latching switch) and as events (for both types of switches). An interested party MAY subscribe to these attributes/events and thus be informed of the interactions, and can perform actions based on this, for example by sending commands to perform an action such as controlling a light or a window shade.

events.name: SwitchLatched
events.description: SwitchLatched

events.name: InitialPress
events.description: InitialPress

events.name: LongPress
events.description: LongPress

events.name: ShortRelease
events.description: ShortRelease

events.name: LongRelease
events.description: LongRelease

events.name: MultiPressOngoing
events.description: MultiPressOngoing

events.name: MultiPressComplete
events.description: MultiPressComplete

Thermostat User Interface Configuration.name: Thermostat User Interface Configuration
Thermostat User Interface Configuration.description: An interface for configuring the user interface of a thermostat (which may be remote from the thermostat).

Relative Humidity Measurement.name: Relative Humidity Measurement
Relative Humidity Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of relative humidity, and reporting relative humidity measurements.

Time Synchronization.name: Time Synchronization
Time Synchronization.description:
Accurate time is required for a number of reasons, including scheduling, display and validating
security materials.

commands.name: SetUtcTime
commands.description: Upon receipt of this command, the server MAY update its UTCTime Attribute to match the time specified in the command

Power Source.name: Power Source
Power Source.description: This cluster is used to describe the configuration and capabilities of a physical power source that provides power to the Node.

events.name: WiredFaultChange
events.description: The WiredFaultChange Event SHALL indicate a change in the set of wired faults currently detected by the Node on this wired power source.

events.name: BatFaultChange
events.description: The BatFaultChange Event SHALL indicate a change in the set of battery faults currently detected by the Node on this battery power source.

events.name: BatChargeFaultChange
events.description: The BatChargeFaultChange Event SHALL indicate a change in the set of charge faults currently detected by the Node on this battery power source.

Thread Network Diagnostics.name: Thread Network Diagnostics
Thread Network Diagnostics.description: The Thread Network Diagnostics Cluster provides a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems

commands.name: ResetCounts
commands.description: Reception of this command SHALL reset the OverrunCount attributes to 0

events.name: ConnectionStatus
events.description: Indicate that a Nodes connection status to a Thread network has changed

events.name: NetworkFaultChange
events.description: Indicate a change in the set of network faults currently detected by the Node

Software Diagnostics.name: Software Diagnostics
Software Diagnostics.description: The Software Diagnostics Cluster provides a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems.

commands.name: ResetWatermarks
commands.description: Reception of this command SHALL reset the values: The StackFreeMinimum field of the ThreadMetrics attribute, CurrentHeapHighWaterMark attribute.

events.name: SoftwareFault
events.description: Indicate the last software fault that has taken place on the Node.

Power Source Configuration.name: Power Source Configuration
Power Source Configuration.description: This cluster is used to describe the configuration and capabilities of a Device's power system.

Group Key Management.name: Group Key Management
Group Key Management.description: The Group Key Management Cluster is the mechanism by which group keys are managed.

commands.name: KeySetWrite
commands.description: Write a new set of keys for the given key set id.

commands.name: KeySetRead
commands.description: Read the keys for a given key set id.

commands.name: KeySetReadResponse
commands.description: Response to KeySetRead

commands.name: KeySetRemove
commands.description: Revoke a Root Key from a Group

commands.name: KeySetReadAllIndices
commands.description: Return the list of Group Key Sets associated with the accessing fabric

commands.name: KeySetReadAllIndicesResponse
commands.description: Reseponse to KeySetReadAllIndices

Pressure Measurement.name: Pressure Measurement
Pressure Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of pressure, and reporting pressure measurements.

Operational Credentials.name: Operational Credentials
Operational Credentials.description: This cluster is used to add or remove Operational Credentials on a Commissionee or Node, as well as manage the associated Fabrics.

commands.name: AttestationRequest
commands.description: Sender is requesting attestation information from the receiver.

commands.name: AttestationResponse
commands.description: An attestation information confirmation from the server.

commands.name: CertificateChainRequest
commands.description: Sender is requesting a device attestation certificate from the receiver.

commands.name: CertificateChainResponse
commands.description: A device attestation certificate (DAC) or product attestation intermediate (PAI) certificate from the server.

commands.name: CSRRequest
commands.description: Sender is requesting a certificate signing request (CSR) from the receiver.

commands.name: CSRResponse
commands.description: A certificate signing request (CSR) from the server.

commands.name: AddNOC
commands.description: Sender is requesting to add the new node operational certificates.

commands.name: UpdateNOC
commands.description: Sender is requesting to update the node operational certificates.

commands.name: NOCResponse
commands.description: Response to AddNOC or UpdateNOC commands.

commands.name: UpdateFabricLabel
commands.description: This command SHALL be used by an Administrative Node to set the user-visible Label field for a given Fabric, as reflected by entries in the Fabrics attribute.

commands.name: RemoveFabric
commands.description: This command is used by Administrative Nodes to remove a given fabric index and delete all associated fabric-scoped data.

commands.name: AddTrustedRootCertificate
commands.description: This command SHALL add a Trusted Root CA Certificate, provided as its CHIP Certificate representation.

Boolean State.name: Boolean State
Boolean State.description: This cluster provides an interface to a boolean state called StateValue.

events.name: StateChange
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when the StateValue attribute changes.

Fault Injection.name: Fault Injection
Fault Injection.description: The Fault Injection Cluster provide a means for a test harness to configure faults(for example triggering a fault in the system).

commands.name: FailAtFault
commands.description: Configure a fault to be triggered deterministically

commands.name: FailRandomlyAtFault
commands.description: Configure a fault to be triggered randomly, with a given probability defined as a percentage

Application Launcher.name: Application Launcher
Application Launcher.description: This cluster provides an interface for launching content on a media player device such as a TV or Speaker.

commands.name: LaunchApp
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL launch the specified app with optional data. The TV Device SHALL launch and bring to foreground the identified application in the command if the application is not already launched and in foreground. The TV Device SHALL update state attribute on the Application Basic cluster of the Endpoint corresponding to the launched application. This command returns a Launch Response.

commands.name: StopApp
commands.description: Upon receipt on a Video Player endpoint this SHALL stop the specified application if it is running.

commands.name: HideApp
commands.description: Upon receipt on a Video Player endpoint this SHALL hide the specified application if it is running and visible.

commands.name: LauncherResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to LaunchApp commands.

Media Playback.name: Media Playback
Media Playback.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling Media Playback (PLAY, PAUSE, etc) on a media device such as a TV or Speaker.

commands.name: Play
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL play media.

commands.name: Pause
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL pause media.

commands.name: Stop
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL stop media. User experience is context-specific. This will often navigate the user back to the location where media was originally launched.

commands.name: StartOver
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Start Over with the current media playback item.

commands.name: Previous
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL cause the handler to be invoked for "Previous". User experience is context-specific. This will often Go back to the previous media playback item.

commands.name: Next
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL cause the handler to be invoked for "Next". User experience is context-specific. This will often Go forward to the next media playback item.

commands.name: Rewind
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Rewind through media. Different Rewind speeds can be used on the TV based upon the number of sequential calls to this function. This is to avoid needing to define every speed now (multiple fast, slow motion, etc).

commands.name: FastForward
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Advance through media. Different FF speeds can be used on the TV based upon the number of sequential calls to this function. This is to avoid needing to define every speed now (multiple fast, slow motion, etc).

commands.name: SkipForward
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Skip forward in the media by the given number of seconds, using the data as follows:

commands.name: SkipBackward
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Skip backward in the media by the given number of seconds, using the data as follows:

commands.name: Seek
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL Skip backward in the media by the given number of seconds, using the data as follows:

commands.name: PlaybackResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to various Playback Request commands.

Bridged Device Basic Information.name: Bridged Device Basic Information
Bridged Device Basic Information.description:
This Cluster serves two purposes towards a Node communicating with a Bridge: indicate that the functionality on
          the Endpoint where it is placed (and its Parts) is bridged from a non-CHIP technology; and provide a centralized
          collection of attributes that the Node MAY collect to aid in conveying information regarding the Bridged Device to a user,
          such as the vendor name, the model name, or user-assigned name.

events.name: StartUp
events.description: The StartUp event SHALL be emitted by a Node as soon as reasonable after completing a boot or reboot process.

events.name: ShutDown
events.description: The ShutDown event SHOULD be emitted by a Node prior to any orderly shutdown sequence on a best-effort basis.

events.name: Leave
events.description: The Leave event SHOULD be emitted by a Node prior to permanently leaving the Fabric.

events.name: ReachableChanged
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when there is a change in the Reachable attribute.

Actions.name: Actions
Actions.description: This cluster provides a standardized way for a Node (typically a Bridge, but could be any Node) to expose action information.

commands.name: InstantAction
commands.description: This command triggers an action (state change) on the involved endpoints.

commands.name: InstantActionWithTransition
commands.description: This command triggers an action (state change) on the involved endpoints, with a specified time to transition from the current state to the new state.

commands.name: StartAction
commands.description: This command triggers the commencement of an action on the involved endpoints.

commands.name: StartActionWithDuration
commands.description: This command triggers the commencement of an action (with a duration) on the involved endpoints.

commands.name: StopAction
commands.description: This command stops the ongoing action on the involved endpoints.

commands.name: PauseAction
commands.description: This command pauses an ongoing action.

commands.name: PauseActionWithDuration
commands.description: This command pauses an ongoing action with a duration.

commands.name: ResumeAction
commands.description: This command resumes a previously paused action.

commands.name: EnableAction
commands.description: This command enables a certain action or automation.

commands.name: EnableActionWithDuration
commands.description: This command enables a certain action or automation with a duration.

commands.name: DisableAction
commands.description: This command disables a certain action or automation.

commands.name: DisableActionWithDuration
commands.description: This command disables a certain action or automation with a duration.

events.name: StateChanged
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when there is a change in the Status of an ActionID.

events.name: ActionFailed
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when there is some error which prevents the action from its normal planned execution.

General Commissioning.name: General Commissioning
General Commissioning.description: This cluster is used to manage global aspects of the Commissioning flow.

commands.name: ArmFailSafe
commands.description: Arm the persistent fail-safe timer with an expiry time of now + ExpiryLengthSeconds using device clock

commands.name: ArmFailSafeResponse
commands.description: Success/failure response for ArmFailSafe command

commands.name: SetRegulatoryConfig
commands.description: Set the regulatory configuration to be used during commissioning

commands.name: SetRegulatoryConfigResponse
commands.description: Success/failure response for SetRegulatoryConfig command

commands.name: CommissioningComplete
commands.description: Signals the Server that the Client has successfully completed all steps of Commissioning/Recofiguration needed during fail-safe period.

commands.name: CommissioningCompleteResponse
commands.description: Indicates to client whether CommissioningComplete command succeeded

Ballast Configuration.name: Ballast Configuration
Ballast Configuration.description: Attributes and commands for configuring a lighting ballast.

Unit Localization.name: Unit Localization
Unit Localization.description:
Nodes should be expected to be deployed to any and all regions of the world. These global regions
      may have differing preferences for the units in which values are conveyed in communication to a
      user. As such, Nodes that visually or audibly convey measurable values to the user need a
      mechanism by which they can be configured to use a users preferred unit.

OTA Software Update Provider.name: OTA Software Update Provider
OTA Software Update Provider.description: Provides an interface for providing OTA software updates

commands.name: QueryImage
commands.description: Determine availability of a new Software Image

commands.name: QueryImageResponse
commands.description: Response to QueryImage command

commands.name: ApplyUpdateRequest
commands.description: Determine next action to take for a downloaded Software Image

commands.name: ApplyUpdateResponse
commands.description: Reponse to ApplyUpdateRequest command

commands.name: NotifyUpdateApplied
commands.description: Notify OTA Provider that an update was applied

OTA Software Update Requestor.name: OTA Software Update Requestor
OTA Software Update Requestor.description: Provides an interface for downloading and applying OTA software updates

commands.name: AnnounceOTAProvider
commands.description: Announce the presence of an OTA Provider

events.name: StateTransition
events.description: This event SHALL be generated when a change of the UpdateState attribute occurs due to an OTA Requestor moving through the states necessary to query for updates.

events.name: VersionApplied
events.description: This event SHALL be generated whenever a new version starts executing after being applied due to a software update.

events.name: DownloadError
events.description: This event SHALL be generated whenever an error occurs during OTA Requestor download operation.

Window Covering.name: Window Covering
Window Covering.description: Provides an interface for controlling and adjusting automatic window coverings.

commands.name: UpOrOpen
commands.description: Moves window covering to InstalledOpenLimitLift and InstalledOpenLimitTilt

commands.name: DownOrClose
commands.description: Moves window covering to InstalledClosedLimitLift and InstalledCloseLimitTilt

commands.name: StopMotion
commands.description: Stop any adjusting of window covering

commands.name: GoToLiftValue
commands.description: Go to lift value specified

commands.name: GoToLiftPercentage
commands.description: Go to lift percentage specified

commands.name: GoToTiltValue
commands.description: Go to tilt value specified

commands.name: GoToTiltPercentage
commands.description: Go to tilt percentage specified

Client Monitoring.name: Client Monitoring
Client Monitoring.description: Client Monitoring allows for ensuring that listed clients meet the required monitoring conditions on the server.

commands.name: RegisterClientMonitoring
commands.description: Register a client to the end device

commands.name: UnregisterClientMonitoring
commands.description: Unregister a client from an end device

commands.name: StayAwakeRequest
commands.description: Request the end device to stay in Active Mode for an additional ActiveModeThreshold

Keypad Input.name: Keypad Input
Keypad Input.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling a device like a TV using action commands such as UP, DOWN, and SELECT.

commands.name: SendKey
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL process a keycode as input to the media device.

commands.name: SendKeyResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to a SendKey Request command.

Application Basic.name: Application Basic
Application Basic.description: This cluster provides information about an application running on a TV or media player device which is represented as an endpoint.

Account Login.name: Account Login
Account Login.description: This cluster provides commands that facilitate user account login on a Content App or a node. For example, a Content App running on a Video Player device, which is represented as an endpoint (see [TV Architecture]), can use this cluster to help make the user account on the Content App match the user account on the Client.

commands.name: GetSetupPIN
commands.description: Upon receipt, the Content App checks if the account associated with the client Temp Account Identifier Rotating ID is the same acount that is active on the given Content App. If the accounts are the same, then the Content App includes the Setup PIN in the GetSetupPIN Response.

commands.name: Login
commands.description: Upon receipt, the Content App checks if the account associated with the clients Temp Account Identifier (Rotating ID) has a current active Setup PIN with the given value. If the Setup PIN is valid for the user account associated with the Temp Account Identifier, then the Content App MAY make that user account active.

commands.name: Logout
commands.description: The purpose of this command is to instruct the Content App to clear the current user account. This command SHOULD be used by clients of a Content App to indicate the end of a user session.

commands.name: GetSetupPINResponse
commands.description: This message is sent in response to the GetSetupPIN Request, and contains the Setup PIN code, or null when the accounts identified in the request does not match the active account of the running Content App.

Access Control.name: Access Control
Access Control.description:
The Access Control Cluster exposes a data model view of a
      Node's Access Control List (ACL), which codifies the rules used to manage
      and enforce Access Control for the Node's endpoints and their associated
      cluster instances.

events.name: AccessControlEntryChanged
events.description: The cluster SHALL send AccessControlEntryChanged events whenever its ACL attribute data is changed by an Administrator.

events.name: AccessControlExtensionChanged
events.description: The cluster SHALL send AccessControlExtensionChanged events whenever its extension attribute data is changed by an Administrator.

Binding.name: Binding
Binding.description: The Binding Cluster is meant to replace the support from the Zigbee Device Object (ZDO) for supporting the binding table.

Identify.name: Identify
Identify.description: Attributes and commands for putting a device into Identification mode (e.g. flashing a light).

commands.name: Identify
commands.description: Command description for Identify

commands.name: TriggerEffect
commands.description: Command description for TriggerEffect

Network Commissioning.name: Network Commissioning
Network Commissioning.description: Functionality to configure, enable, disable network credentials and access on a Matter device.

commands.name: ScanNetworks
commands.description: Detemine the set of networks the device sees as available.

commands.name: ScanNetworksResponse
commands.description: Relay the set of networks the device sees as available back to the client.

commands.name: AddOrUpdateWiFiNetwork
commands.description: Add or update the credentials for a given Wi-Fi network.

commands.name: AddOrUpdateThreadNetwork
commands.description: Add or update the credentials for a given Thread network.

commands.name: RemoveNetwork
commands.description: Remove the definition of a given network (including its credentials).

commands.name: NetworkConfigResponse
commands.description: Response command for various commands that add/remove/modify network credentials.

commands.name: ConnectNetwork
commands.description: Connect to the specified network, using previously-defined credentials.

commands.name: ConnectNetworkResponse
commands.description: Command that indicates whether we have succcessfully connected to a network.

commands.name: ReorderNetwork
commands.description: Modify the order in which networks will be presented in the Networks attribute.

User Label.name: User Label
User Label.description: The User Label Cluster provides a feature to tag an endpoint with zero or more labels.

On/Off.name: On/Off
On/Off.description: Attributes and commands for switching devices between 'On' and 'Off' states.

commands.name: Off
commands.description: On receipt of this command, a device SHALL enter its Off state. This state is device dependent, but it is recommended that it is used for power off or similar functions. On receipt of the Off command, the OnTime attribute SHALL be set to 0.

commands.name: On
commands.description: On receipt of this command, a device SHALL enter its On state. This state is device dependent, but it is recommended that it is used for power on or similar functions. On receipt of the On command, if the value of the OnTime attribute is equal to 0, the device SHALL set the OffWaitTime attribute to 0.

commands.name: Toggle
commands.description: On receipt of this command, if a device is in its Off state it SHALL enter its On state. Otherwise, if it is in its On state it SHALL enter its Off state. On receipt of the Toggle command, if the value of the OnOff attribute is equal to FALSE and if the value of the OnTime attribute is equal to 0, the device SHALL set the OffWaitTime attribute to 0. If the value of the OnOff attribute is equal to TRUE, the OnTime attribute SHALL be set to 0.

commands.name: OffWithEffect
commands.description: The OffWithEffect command allows devices to be turned off using enhanced ways of fading.

commands.name: OnWithRecallGlobalScene
commands.description: The OnWithRecallGlobalScene command allows the recall of the settings when the device was turned off.

commands.name: OnWithTimedOff
commands.description: The OnWithTimedOff command allows devices to be turned on for a specific duration with a guarded off duration so that SHOULD the device be subsequently switched off, further OnWithTimedOff commands, received during this time, are prevented from turning the devices back on.

Audio Output.name: Audio Output
Audio Output.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling the Output on a media device such as a TV.

commands.name: SelectOutput
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL change the output on the media device to the output at a specific index in the Output List.

commands.name: RenameOutput
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL rename the output at a specific index in the Output List. Updates to the output name SHALL appear in the TV settings menus.

Localization Configuration.name: Localization Configuration
Localization Configuration.description:
Nodes should be expected to be deployed to any and all regions of the world. These global regions
      may have differing common languages, units of measurements, and numerical formatting
      standards. As such, Nodes that visually or audibly convey information need a mechanism by which
      they can be configured to use a users preferred language, units, etc

Target Navigator.name: Target Navigator
Target Navigator.description: This cluster provides an interface for UX navigation within a set of targets on a device or endpoint.

commands.name: NavigateTarget
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL navigation the UX to the target identified.

commands.name: NavigateTargetResponse
commands.description: This command SHALL be generated in response to NavigateTarget commands.

Basic Information.name: Basic Information
Basic Information.description:
This cluster provides attributes and events for determining basic information about Nodes, which supports both
      Commissioning and operational determination of Node characteristics, such as Vendor ID, Product ID and serial number,
      which apply to the whole Node. Also allows setting user device information such as location.

events.name: StartUp
events.description: The StartUp event SHALL be emitted by a Node as soon as reasonable after completing a boot or reboot process.

events.name: ShutDown
events.description: The ShutDown event SHOULD be emitted by a Node prior to any orderly shutdown sequence on a best-effort basis.

events.name: Leave
events.description: The Leave event SHOULD be emitted by a Node prior to permanently leaving the Fabric.

events.name: ReachableChanged
events.description: This event (when supported) SHALL be generated when there is a change in the Reachable attribute.

Pump Configuration and Control.name: Pump Configuration and Control
Pump Configuration and Control.description: An interface for configuring and controlling pumps.

events.name: SupplyVoltageLow
events.description: SupplyVoltageLow

events.name: SupplyVoltageHigh
events.description: SupplyVoltageHigh

events.name: PowerMissingPhase
events.description: PowerMissingPhase

events.name: SystemPressureLow
events.description: SystemPressureLow

events.name: SystemPressureHigh
events.description: SystemPressureHigh

events.name: DryRunning
events.description: DryRunning

events.name: MotorTemperatureHigh
events.description: MotorTemperatureHigh

events.name: PumpMotorFatalFailure
events.description: PumpMotorFatalFailure

events.name: ElectronicTemperatureHigh
events.description: ElectronicTemperatureHigh

events.name: PumpBlocked
events.description: PumpBlocked

events.name: SensorFailure
events.description: SensorFailure

events.name: ElectronicNonFatalFailure
events.description: ElectronicNonFatalFailure

events.name: ElectronicFatalFailure
events.description: ElectronicFatalFailure

events.name: GeneralFault
events.description: GeneralFault

events.name: Leakage
events.description: Leakage

events.name: AirDetection
events.description: AirDetection

events.name: TurbineOperation
events.description: TurbineOperation

Descriptor.name: Descriptor
Descriptor.description: The Descriptor Cluster is meant to replace the support from the Zigbee Device Object (ZDO) for describing a node, its endpoints and clusters.

Media Input.name: Media Input
Media Input.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling the Input Selector on a media device such as a TV.

commands.name: SelectInput
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL change the input on the media device to the input at a specific index in the Input List.

commands.name: ShowInputStatus
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL display the active status of the input list on screen.

commands.name: HideInputStatus
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL hide the input list from the screen.

commands.name: RenameInput
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL rename the input at a specific index in the Input List. Updates to the input name SHALL appear in the TV settings menus.

Ethernet Network Diagnostics.name: Ethernet Network Diagnostics
Ethernet Network Diagnostics.description: The Ethernet Network Diagnostics Cluster provides a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems.

commands.name: ResetCounts
commands.description: Reception of this command SHALL reset the attributes: PacketRxCount, PacketTxCount, TxErrCount, CollisionCount, OverrunCount to 0

Occupancy Sensing.name: Occupancy Sensing
Occupancy Sensing.description: Attributes and commands for configuring occupancy sensing, and reporting occupancy status.

Diagnostic Logs.name: Diagnostic Logs
Diagnostic Logs.description: The cluster provides commands for retrieving unstructured diagnostic logs from a Node that may be used to aid in diagnostics.

commands.name: RetrieveLogsRequest
commands.description: Retrieving diagnostic logs from a Node

commands.name: RetrieveLogsResponse
commands.description: Response to the RetrieveLogsRequest

Channel.name: Channel
Channel.description: This cluster provides an interface for controlling the current Channel on a device.

commands.name: ChangeChannel
commands.description: Change the channel on the media player to the channel case-insensitive exact matching the value passed as an argument.

commands.name: ChangeChannelByNumber
commands.description: Change the channel on the media plaeyer to the channel with the given Number in the ChannelList attribute.

commands.name: SkipChannel
commands.description: This command provides channel up and channel down functionality, but allows channel index jumps of size Count. When the value of the increase or decrease is larger than the number of channels remaining in the given direction, then the behavior SHALL be to return to the beginning (or end) of the channel list and continue. For example, if the current channel is at index 0 and count value of -1 is given, then the current channel should change to the last channel.

commands.name: ChangeChannelResponse
commands.description: Upon receipt, this SHALL display the active status of the input list on screen.

Wake on LAN.name: Wake on LAN
Wake on LAN.description: This cluster provides an interface for managing low power mode on a device that supports the Wake On LAN protocol.

Low Power.name: Low Power
Low Power.description: This cluster provides an interface for managing low power mode on a device.

commands.name: Sleep
commands.description: This command shall put the device into low power mode.

Temperature Measurement.name: Temperature Measurement
Temperature Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of temperature, and reporting temperature measurements.

Fixed Label.name: Fixed Label
Fixed Label.description:
The Fixed Label Cluster provides a feature for the device to tag an endpoint with zero or more read only
labels.

Flow Measurement.name: Flow Measurement
Flow Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of flow, and reporting flow measurements.

WiFi Network Diagnostics.name: WiFi Network Diagnostics
WiFi Network Diagnostics.description: The Wi-Fi Network Diagnostics Cluster provides a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems.

commands.name: ResetCounts
commands.description: Reception of this command SHALL reset the Breacon and Packet related count attributes to 0

events.name: Disconnection
events.description: Indicate that a Nodes Wi-Fi connection has been disconnected as a result of de-authenticated or dis-association and indicates the reason.

events.name: AssociationFailure
events.description: Indicate that a Node has failed to connect, or reconnect, to a Wi-Fi access point.

events.name: ConnectionStatus
events.description: Indicate that a Nodes connection status to a Wi-Fi network has changed.

Thermostat.name: Thermostat
Thermostat.description: An interface for configuring and controlling the functionality of a thermostat.

commands.name: SetpointRaiseLower
commands.description: Command description for SetpointRaiseLower

commands.name: SetWeeklySchedule
commands.description: Command description for SetWeeklySchedule

commands.name: GetWeeklySchedule
commands.description: Command description for GetWeeklySchedule

commands.name: ClearWeeklySchedule
commands.description: The Clear Weekly Schedule command is used to clear the weekly schedule.

commands.name: GetWeeklyScheduleResponse
commands.description: The Current Weekly Schedule Command is sent from the server in response to the Get Weekly Schedule Command.

Level Control.name: Level Control
Level Control.description: Attributes and commands for controlling devices that can be set to a level between fully 'On' and fully 'Off.'

commands.name: MoveToLevel
commands.description: Command description for MoveToLevel

commands.name: Move
commands.description: Command description for Move

commands.name: Step
commands.description: Command description for Step

commands.name: Stop
commands.description: Command description for Stop

commands.name: MoveToLevelWithOnOff
commands.description: Command description for MoveToLevelWithOnOff

commands.name: MoveWithOnOff
commands.description: Command description for MoveWithOnOff

commands.name: StepWithOnOff
commands.description: Command description for StepWithOnOff

commands.name: StopWithOnOff
commands.description: Command description for StopWithOnOff

commands.name: MoveToClosestFrequency
commands.description:
Change the currrent frequency to the provided one, or a close
        approximation if the exact provided one is not possible.

Groups.name: Groups
Groups.description: Attributes and commands for group configuration and manipulation.

commands.name: AddGroup
commands.description: Command description for AddGroup

commands.name: ViewGroup
commands.description: Command description for ViewGroup

commands.name: GetGroupMembership
commands.description: Command description for GetGroupMembership

commands.name: RemoveGroup
commands.description: Command description for RemoveGroup

commands.name: RemoveAllGroups
commands.description: Command description for RemoveAllGroups

commands.name: AddGroupIfIdentifying
commands.description: Command description for AddGroupIfIdentifying

commands.name: AddGroupResponse
commands.description: Command description for AddGroupResponse

commands.name: ViewGroupResponse
commands.description: Command description for ViewGroupResponse

commands.name: GetGroupMembershipResponse
commands.description: Command description for GetGroupMembershipResponse

commands.name: RemoveGroupResponse
commands.description: Command description for RemoveGroupResponse

Time Format Localization.name: Time Format Localization
Time Format Localization.description:
Nodes should be expected to be deployed to any and all regions of the world. These global regions
      may have differing preferences for how dates and times are conveyed. As such, Nodes that visually
      or audibly convey time information need a mechanism by which they can be configured to use a
      users preferred format.

General Diagnostics.name: General Diagnostics
General Diagnostics.description: The General Diagnostics Cluster, along with other diagnostics clusters, provide a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrative Node in diagnosing potential problems.

commands.name: TestEventTrigger
commands.description: Provide a means for certification tests to trigger some test-plan-specific events

events.name: HardwareFaultChange
events.description: Indicate a change in the set of hardware faults currently detected by the Node.

events.name: RadioFaultChange
events.description: Indicate a change in the set of radio faults currently detected by the Node.

events.name: NetworkFaultChange
events.description: Indicate a change in the set of network faults currently detected by the Node.

events.name: BootReason
events.description: Indicate the reason that caused the device to start-up.

Scenes.name: Scenes
Scenes.description: Attributes and commands for scene configuration and manipulation.

commands.name: AddScene
commands.description: Add a scene to the scene table. Extension field sets are supported, and are inputed as '{"ClusterID": VALUE, "AttributeValueList":[{"AttributeId": VALUE, "AttributeValue": VALUE}]}'

commands.name: ViewScene
commands.description: Retrieves the requested scene entry from its Scene table.

commands.name: RemoveScene
commands.description: Removes the requested scene entry, corresponding to the value of the GroupID field, from its Scene Table

commands.name: RemoveAllScenes
commands.description: Remove all scenes, corresponding to the value of the GroupID field, from its Scene Table

commands.name: StoreScene
commands.description: Adds the scene entry into its Scene Table along with all extension field sets corresponding to the current state of other clusters on the same endpoint

commands.name: RecallScene
commands.description: Set the attributes and corresponding state for each other cluster implemented on the endpoint accordingly to the resquested scene entry in the Scene Table

commands.name: GetSceneMembership
commands.description: Get an unused scene identifier when no commissioning tool is in the network, or for a commissioning tool to get the used scene identifiers within a certain group

commands.name: EnhancedAddScene
commands.description: Allows a scene to be added using a finer scene transition time than the AddScene command.

commands.name: EnhancedViewScene
commands.description: Allows a scene to be retrieved using a finer scene transition time than the ViewScene command

commands.name: CopyScene
commands.description: Allows a client to efficiently copy scenes from one group/scene identifier pair to another group/scene identifier pair.

commands.name: AddSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast AddScene command,

commands.name: ViewSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast ViewScene command

commands.name: RemoveSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast RemoveScene command

commands.name: RemoveAllScenesResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast RemoveAllScenes command

commands.name: StoreSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast StoreScene command

commands.name: GetSceneMembershipResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast GetSceneMembership command

commands.name: EnhancedAddSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast EnhancedAddScene command

commands.name: EnhancedViewSceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast EnhancedViewScene command

commands.name: CopySceneResponse
commands.description: The command is generated in response to a received unicast CopyScene command

Administrator Commissioning.name: Administrator Commissioning
Administrator Commissioning.description: Commands to trigger a Node to allow a new Administrator to commission it.

commands.name: OpenCommissioningWindow
commands.description: This command is used by a current Administrator to instruct a Node to go into commissioning mode using enhanced commissioning method.

commands.name: OpenBasicCommissioningWindow
commands.description: This command is used by a current Administrator to instruct a Node to go into commissioning mode using basic commissioning method, if the node supports it.

commands.name: RevokeCommissioning
commands.description: This command is used by a current Administrator to instruct a Node to revoke any active Open Commissioning Window or Open Basic Commissioning Window command.

Mode Select.name: Mode Select
Mode Select.description: Attributes and commands for selecting a mode from a list of supported options.

commands.name: ChangeToMode
commands.description: On receipt of this command, if the NewMode field matches the Mode field in an entry of the SupportedModes list, the server SHALL set the CurrentMode attribute to the NewMode value, otherwise, the server SHALL respond with an INVALID_COMMAND status response.

Illuminance Measurement.name: Illuminance Measurement
Illuminance Measurement.description: Attributes and commands for configuring the measurement of illuminance, and reporting illuminance measurements.

Pulse Width Modulation.name: Pulse Width Modulation
Pulse Width Modulation.description: Cluster to control pulse width modulation

Unit Testing.name: Unit Testing
Unit Testing.description: The Test Cluster is meant to validate the generated code

commands.name: Test
commands.description: Simple command without any parameters and without a specific response

commands.name: TestNotHandled
commands.description: Simple command without any parameters and without a specific response not handled by the server

commands.name: TestSpecific
commands.description: Simple command without any parameters and with a specific response

commands.name: TestUnknownCommand
commands.description: Simple command that should not be added to the server.

commands.name: TestAddArguments
commands.description: Command that takes two arguments and returns their sum.

commands.name: TestSimpleArgumentRequest
commands.description: Command that takes an argument which is bool

commands.name: TestStructArrayArgumentRequest
commands.description: Command that takes various arguments that are arrays, including an array of structs which have a list member.

commands.name: TestStructArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is struct.  The response echoes the
        'b' field of the single arg.

commands.name: TestNestedStructArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is nested struct.  The response
        echoes the 'b' field of ar1.c.

commands.name: TestListStructArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a list of structs.  The response
        returns false if there is some struct in the list whose 'b' field is
        false, and true otherwise (including if the list is empty).

commands.name: TestListInt8UArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a list of INT8U.  The response
        returns false if the list contains a 0 in it, true otherwise (including
        if the list is empty).

commands.name: TestNestedStructListArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a Nested Struct List.  The
        response returns false if there is some struct in arg1 (either directly
        in arg1.c or in the arg1.d list) whose 'b' field is false, and true
        otherwise.

commands.name: TestListNestedStructListArgumentRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a list of Nested Struct List.
        The response returns false if there is some struct in arg1 (either
        directly in as the 'c' field of an entry 'd' list of an entry) whose 'b'
        field is false, and true otherwise (including if the list is empty).

commands.name: TestListInt8UReverseRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a list of INT8U and expects a
        response that reverses the list.

commands.name: TestEnumsRequest
commands.description:
Command that sends a vendor id and an enum.  The server is expected to
        echo them back.

commands.name: TestNullableOptionalRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is nullable and optional.  The
        response returns a boolean indicating whether the argument was present,
        if that's true a boolean indicating whether the argument was null, and
        if that' false the argument it received.

commands.name: TestComplexNullableOptionalRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes various arguments which can be nullable and/or optional.  The
        response returns information about which things were received and what
        their state was.

commands.name: SimpleStructEchoRequest
commands.description:
Command that takes an argument which is a struct.  The response echoes
        the struct back.

commands.name: TimedInvokeRequest
commands.description:
Command that just responds with a success status if the timed invoke
        conditions are met.

commands.name: TestSimpleOptionalArgumentRequest
commands.description: Command that takes an optional argument which is bool. It responds with a success value if the optional is set to any value.

commands.name: TestEmitTestEventRequest
commands.description: Command that takes identical arguments to the fields of the TestEvent and logs the TestEvent to the buffer.  Command returns an event ID as the response.

commands.name: TestEmitTestFabricScopedEventRequest
commands.description: Command that takes identical arguments to the fields of the TestFabricScopedEvent and logs the TestFabricScopedEvent to the buffer.  Command returns an event ID as the response.

commands.name: TestSpecificResponse
commands.description: Simple response for TestWithResponse with a simple return value

commands.name: TestAddArgumentsResponse
commands.description: Response for TestAddArguments that returns the sum.

commands.name: TestSimpleArgumentResponse
commands.description: Simple response for TestSimpleArgumentRequest with a simple return value

commands.name: TestStructArrayArgumentResponse
commands.description: Response for TestStructArrayArgumentRequest with complicated return arguments

commands.name: TestListInt8UReverseResponse
commands.description: Response that delivers the reversed list of uint8.

commands.name: TestEnumsResponse
commands.description: Response that delivers a vendor id and an enum..

commands.name: TestNullableOptionalResponse
commands.description:
Delivers information about the argument TestNullableOptionalRequest had,
        and the original value if there was one.

commands.name: TestComplexNullableOptionalResponse
commands.description: Delivers information about the arguments TestComplexNullableOptionalRequest had.

commands.name: BooleanResponse
commands.description:
Delivers a single boolean argument. What the argument means depends on
        what we're responding to.

commands.name: SimpleStructResponse
commands.description:
Command that returns a single argument which is a struct.  The contents
        of the struct depend on what we are responding to.

commands.name: TestEmitTestEventResponse
commands.description: Delivers the ID of an event in response to test command emitting fabric scoped events.

commands.name: TestEmitTestFabricScopedEventResponse
commands.description: Delivers the ID of an event in response to test command emitting fabric scope events.

events.name: TestEvent
events.description: Example test event

events.name: TestFabricScopedEvent
events.description: Example test event

Color Control.name: Color Control
Color Control.description: Attributes and commands for controlling the color properties of a color-capable light.

commands.name: MoveToHue
commands.description: Move to specified hue.

commands.name: MoveHue
commands.description: Move hue up or down at specified rate.

commands.name: StepHue
commands.description: Step hue up or down by specified size at specified rate.

commands.name: MoveToSaturation
commands.description: Move to specified saturation.

commands.name: MoveSaturation
commands.description: Move saturation up or down at specified rate.

commands.name: StepSaturation
commands.description: Step saturation up or down by specified size at specified rate.

commands.name: MoveToHueAndSaturation
commands.description: Move to hue and saturation.

commands.name: MoveToColor
commands.description: Move to specified color.

commands.name: MoveColor
commands.description: Moves the color.

commands.name: StepColor
commands.description: Steps the lighting to a specific color.

commands.name: MoveToColorTemperature
commands.description: Move to a specific color temperature.

Fan Control.name: Fan Control
Fan Control.description: An interface for controlling a fan in a heating/cooling system.
